description.value:
Thieves are skilled in the art of the transition. The transition of one’s attention from here to there. The transition of items of theirs to yours. The transition of here and gone.

As a master thief, you gain the following Thief abilities:

Steal (1 Finger)

As an action, you swipe a random item from a creature within 5 feet of you. Roll a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, with advantage if they don’t know that you’re there, and with disadvantage if they are actively hostile toward or suspicious of you.

Regardless of the result, you steal one item from the target as determined by the GM, with higher results meaning you swipe larger or rarer items from the target’s possession. With this ability, you cannot steal any items they are being directly held or clutched, or that are not easily detachable, nor items they do not possess.

If the creature has no separate items or equipment in their possession, or if it would better match the Steal roll’s result, you instead break, tear, or cut off a piece of the creature to take as an item. As a result, the creature’s natural weapons are reduced by 1 die size. This can only be done once per creature, and lasts until their next long rest.

Swipe (3 Fingers)

As an action, you attempt to take a held or clutched weapon or item from a creature within 5 feet of you. Roll a contested Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check against the target. If you succeed, you take the item from their hand, and are proficient in the weapon for the next 1 minute.

If the stolen item is a weapon, you can immediately make an attack against the target using this weapon.

Mug

If you hit a creature as part of the Attack Action, you can use either Steal or Swipe against that creature as a Minor Action before the end of your turn.

system.requirements: Must have the Rogue Starter Abilities
